member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize database. Required once per application lifetime. If user or pass is not supplied, admin-admin is used.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.GetTables
member.summary: Get list of tables.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.GetExistingIndexes
member.summary: Get existing indexes.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.GetTableDefinition(System.String)
member.summary: Gets definition of a table.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.Table``1
member.summary: Indicates which table operation is to be performed on.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.Table``1(LinqdbClient.LinqdbTransaction)
member.summary: Indicates which table operation is to be performed on. Modification operations are performed in a given transaction.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.Replicate(System.String)
member.summary: Live replication of the database. If 'path' exists it will be deleted. Works best when database is least used.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.Db.Dispose
member.summary: No operation

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.ILinqDbQueryable`1.Save(`0)
member.summary: Saves new item if Id = 0 and assigns new Id. Updates existing item if Id is existing's item's Id.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.ILinqDbQueryable`1.SaveBatch(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0})
member.summary: Same as Save but more efficient.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.ILinqDbQueryable`1.Count
member.summary: Record count.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.ILinqDbQueryable`1.GetIds
member.summary: Get selected ids without having to select them (more efficiently). If AllIds is true Ids is intentionally empty.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.ILinqDbQueryable`1.LastStep
member.summary: Last search step. To be used in step-search.

member.summary: Deletes item with given Id.

member.summary: Deletes items with given Ids.

member.name: M:LinqdbClient.ILinqDbQueryable`1.AtomicIncrement``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}},System.Int32,`0,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Atomically increment (decrement) value (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linearizability). Returns old value or null if item was created. Must be used after (and only) .Where, which identifies single record to update.
